results.title: A Goal to win
results.brief_description: A must for every school and netball club. “A Goal to Win” is unique in its concept as a training video. Some of the exciting aspects covered are: Concentration, Individual Fitness, Team Cohesion, Self-Discipline, Team Tactics, Individual Skills, Motivation and Training Routines. The video traces players from beginners to elite players.

The video traces players from beginners to elite players.

results.title: A Glittering song
results.creator_credit: Praha Loutkovy Film and Short Film Studio
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film in which bits of coloured glass and graphic art appear, change, and shift in an endless variety of patterns. This live action documentary technique creates a fantasy world of colour, light and form with a slight thread of story involving a child.

results.title: A Glimpse at a thousand points
results.brief_description: A discussion of the discoveries of the light deflector. Cathodes ray tube and photocell lead to a simple explanation of how television works and modern developments in television technology.

results.title: A Gift to grow on
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie and U.S. Committee for UNICEF
results.brief_description: The United Nations Children’s Fund. US committee for UNICEF gets ready for its biggest workload. This documentary explains to young children exactly where this money goes. Its example: a poor town in Mexico where UNICEF provides medical help, education and entertainment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Zabriskie and U.S. Committee for UNICEF

results.title: A Giant people: the Watussi of Africa
results.creator_credit: George Herzog and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A historical record of a traditional tribal culture as it existed in the 1930’s. Shows family life in a royal Watusi household, activities within the cattle-based economic system and ancient Watusi ceremonies and dances.

results.title: A Gentle birth (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
This film shows the Le Boyer method of delivery - the childbirth experience of one woman where technological intervention is kept to a minimum, and drugs are replaced by a relaxed supportive environment, with the father present to reassure and comfort the mother. Narrated by Dr. Harry Tischler.

results.title: A Future on Rail
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film intended to show young people the changes taking place in rail-roads and the new sources of employment to be found in them.

results.title: A Future for the past
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.

results.title: A Frog's life
results.brief_description: After collecting frog spawn from a river and putting it into a tank, young children observe the hatching of the spawn and the development of the tadpoles into frogs. Close-up photography is used in recording the gradual change in the frog’s development.
